intro: Bothriocline marungensis, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to the dry, rocky environments it inhabits. Bothriocline marungensis is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
